title: Fix issue creation for non-collaborators
message:
Fix issue creation for non-collaborators

If the current user does not have push access to the current repository,
he is not allowed to see the contributors.
The HTTP Response therefore has the status 403, which is handled as error.

fix #939

title: Update lint rules
message:

title: ArraysAsListWithZeroOrOneArgument
message:
ArraysAsListWithZeroOrOneArgument

Reports any calls to Arrays.asList() with zero arguments or only one argument. Such calls could be replaced with either a call to Collections.singletonList() or Collections.emptyList() which will save some memory.

title: StringBufferReplaceableByString
message:
StringBufferReplaceableByString

Reports any variables declared as or uses of java.lang.StringBuffer and java.lang.StringBuilder which can be replaced with a single java.lang.String concatenation. Using a String concatenation makes the code shorter and simpler. This inspection only reports when the resulting concatenation is at least as efficient or more efficient than the original StringBuffer or StringBuilder use.

title: Fixing lint error "SuspiciousImport: 'import android.R' statement"
message:
Fixing lint error "SuspiciousImport: 'import android.R' statement"

 ../../src/main/java/com/github/mobile/ui/SlidingTabStrip.java:19: Don't include android.R here; use a fully qualified name for each usage instead

Priority: 9 / 10
Category: Correctness
Severity: Warning
Explanation: 'import android.R' statement.
Importing android.R is usually not intentional; it sometimes happens when you use an IDE and ask it to automatically add imports at a time when your project's R class it not present.

Once the import is there you might get a lot of "confusing" error messages because of course the fields available on android.R are not the ones you'd expect from just looking at your own R class.

Improve navdrawer UI

This does a few things:
* Runs the nav drawer underneath the statusbar in lollipop+ devices to match the material spec
* Enlarges the text and avatar in the header
* Add real name text field and show if it's available
* Extend height of header to more naturally wrap the content within it

title: Use dark actionbar popuptheme
message:
Use dark actionbar popuptheme

Meant to include this in the last commit as part of the switch to AppCompat.Light.DarkActionBar

title: Use more appropriate Theme.Light.DarkActionBar
message:
Use more appropriate Theme.Light.DarkActionBar

The app theme in general is light with a dark actionbar, but just declaring it as the standard dark UI causes some issues with widgets like checkboxes defaulting to white on the light window backgrounds. This solves elegantly solves that issue for us

title: Move comment edit/delete controls to a popup menu with overflow
message:
Move comment edit/delete controls to a popup menu with overflow

This eliminates the need to have a second set of delete/edit icons for placing in the comment, and also makes it a little less redundant by moving them into a popup menu. When you have menu items of sorts in list items, it's more conventional to have them hidden unless the user needs them to avoid cluttering the view.

title: Replace existing icons with new material variants where appropriate
message:
Replace existing icons with new material variants where appropriate

Was able to remove some that were duplicates or already existed in appcompat.

This doesn't touch the icons in nodpi

Also removed one instance (delete history) where it was used in a menu but never actually shown. This allows us to use a regular grey one for the repo dialogs and now have to worry about adding a second one that's white to match the actionbar.

title: Switch from ActionBarSherlock to AppCompat
message:
Switch from ActionBarSherlock to AppCompat

Few things:
* Required upping the minSDK version to 11. At that point, might as well put it at 15, there's maybe 0.1% users that fall between those two.
* Updated .gitignore because Android Studio was really annoyed with me
* Required stenciling in some support classes to use RoboGuice in ActionBarActivities from AppCompat
* Removed version code/name and target/min SDK settings from AndroidManifest since they're overridden by gradle anyway

Links that can't be opened by the app will try to get as close as

https://github.com/github/android/ and then https://github.com/github/

title: Scale down avatar images to save memory.
message:
Scale down avatar images to save memory.

This gets the maximal display size of avatars from the style specification
and downsamples the loaded avatar images to be close to that size, with no
(to me) visible degradation of quality. Bonus: you actually see the rounded
corners of the images now.

Before this patch, each loaded avatar image occupied 850k of RAM, causing
the app to OOM after longer usage. With this patch, one image occupies
50k of RAM, preventing OOMs (device: Moto X).

Fixes #513
Might be a fix for #509

title: Remove ambiguous entries in Italian translation
message:
Remove ambiguous entries in Italian translation

The Italian translation is using "cancella" to translate various English terms like "cancel", "delete", "clear" o "un-something", this is confusing if some of these terms are used near each other (e.g. two buttons "cancel" and "delete").

See issue https://github.com/github/android/issues/498

title: Check for existing token during two-factor login
message:
Check for existing token during two-factor login

OAuth2 token notes must be unique so without this check a
login from a 2nd device will fail when it tries to create an
authorization and one already exists.

title: cull ldpi.
message:
cull ldpi.

Android resizes images as needed, and only <10% of Android devices are
ldpi. Therefore these drawables take up space that can easily be
regained by having the relatively few ldpi devices scale icons on their
own.

title: Remove full HTML when raw HTML value changes
message:
Remove full HTML when raw HTML value changes

Previously the issue body html was not being re-encoded
after edits and also the full html was never being flushed
when the raw version has changed from the last time it was
encoded.

This would cause the issue description to not update after
being edited.

Closes #353

title: Always call setCurrentItem from updateCurrentItem
message:
Always call setCurrentItem from updateCurrentItem

Previously updateCurrentItem() was only called if pager.setItem()
returned true which would not be the case when the pager was manually
swiped since the position had already been set to the new value.

Closes #352

title: Load embedded images using contents API
message:
Load embedded images using contents API

Previously repository paths embedded as images in
comments, issues, etc. were requested by including
username/password credentials in a standard HTTP
request.

This is no longer possible now that OAuth tokens
are used in the app and these URLs do not accept
authenticate using tokens.  The contents API does
support OAuth tokens and can be used to request
embedded images that start with blob or raw in
their paths.

into a single adapter that contains items for all the

This allows views to be reused and remove the ugliness
of deferring from one parent adapter to two different
child adapters depending on the position

title: Delegate menu creation from activity to current fragment
message:
Delegate menu creation from activity to current fragment

Menu items would previously occasionally not be selectable
on Gingerbread and possibly other platforms when fragments
in a ViewPager were contributing menu items.  Now the
activity delegates directly to the fragments to create
the options menu and the fragments no longer call
setHasOptionsMenu which appears to remove the problem and
the menu items are now always selectable.

Closes issue #178

This is for differentiating between the terms "label"

Hence, "labels" are prefixed to avoid confusion.

a dialog describing the conflict and how it can
be resolved.

message:
Use TextUtils.isEmpty on password field

This was initially using isDigitsOnly which was
incorrect since only a non-empty password was
intended to be verified to determine enablement
of the login action bar button.

Closes issue #76

message: Add banner graphic

title: Add browsable category to action view intent before starting
message:
Add browsable category to action view intent before starting

This ensures the GitHub app is not shown as a possible
target for the sign up link since that must be done
from a browser.

message: Dark color and reduce size of text in custom progress dialog

message:

still useful in case styling differences arise since
all layouts are already configured to use them.

title: Use custom progress dialog layout on Froyo
message:
Use custom progress dialog layout on Froyo

Previously the spinner was stationary on Froyo and
would never animate.

title: Force inverse background on pre-ICS progress dialogs
message:
Force inverse background on pre-ICS progress dialogs

The octocat spinner is meant for a light background
and enabling this shows a light colored dialog similar
to holo light theme on ICS.

title: Use LinkedList.addFirst instead of LinkedList.push
message:
Use LinkedList.addFirst instead of LinkedList.push

LinkedList.push is Java 1.6 which will cause issues
on Froyo

message: Set exported attribute to false on all provider elements

message: Add commit SHA-1 and message to push event details area

title: Verify fork count is greater than zero
message:
Verify fork count is greater than zero

Guards against a negative value being denoted
as complete.

title: Check for repository completeness before configuring pager
message:
Check for repository completeness before configuring pager

Previously a repository opened from the news feed with a
valid owner would be missing an issues page even if issues
were enabled.  This was because the avatar URL was present
but the repository details were not checked for completeness.

Add a simple checking mechanism to know whether we are
dealing with a repository model class returned from an
API call or the database cache.

title: Handle case where first loader fails
message:
Handle case where first loader fails

Previously if the first loader throws an exception
then the empty view will be shown and subsequent calls
to setListShown will be ignored since listShown is
already set to true.

An additional check has been added when the shown value
is unchanging but the empty state may have changed so
a subsequent successful refresh will now show the list
and hide the empty view with no fade effect.

are really pull requests can now be opened for

IssueStore now checks if an issue fetch failure is
due to a 410 indicating that issues are disabled and
the pull request API must be used for the issue model.

title: Put list item update logic in list adapter extensions
message:
Put list item update logic in list adapter extensions

Storing details on updating the view inside the holders
presents complexity since holders have to do the bookkeeping
and that often requires extra objects being stored and logic
being run once per view holder.

Moving this to the adapter allows it to be computed once
and reset when the items change and doesn't require storing
state between all the holders.

The new pattern is to create an ItemView extension that exposes
public final fields for each view element that get updated and
then the list adapter will contain the logic on how the view
should be updated.

poor user experience, was slow, jittery, and sometimes unreliable
about reported sizes.

adds further support for supporting tags not currently

title: add integration test for Org switcher and Org repo-list display
message:
add integration test for Org switcher and Org repo-list display

This just pages through the Orgs and checks that the repo list updates
to show at least one repo name known to be in the selected org. I've
added this test because I recently unwittingly broke the Org switcher
with 6708c75- the associated code is fragile and I'd like to make sure I
don't break it again! I'm a little concerned that the integration test
itself might be rather brittle but time will tell on that front...

This commit includes a tweak to cope with pre-ICS Spinner by ABS:
Instead of android.widget.Spinner, ABS uses
'com.actionbarsherlock.internal.widget.IcsSpinner' for the actionbar
dropdown on pre-ICS devices, so the integration test was failing to find
the dropdown on pre-ics devices.

title: A dummy file that will hopefully force installation of SDK 15
message:
A dummy file that will hopefully force installation of SDK 15

We need SDK 15 for compiling against ABS 4, but we don't want to *run*
the integration tests against it - we want to ensure our tests run
against the oldest version of Android we support, currently level 8.

The Janky build is configured to run against level 8, so that's what the
Android-Emulator-Plugin kindly installs for us - but we'd like it to
install level 15 as well. Hopefully this file will trigger that:

https://github.com/jenkinsci/android-emulator-plugin/blob/8a087d83a31975a008a9a90b2782bf871acd6ce8/src/main/java/hudson/plugins/android_emulator/builder/ProjectPrerequisitesInstaller.java#L83-102

title: Fix recently-viewed repos - 'Recent' labels now show correctly
message:
Fix recently-viewed repos - 'Recent' labels now show correctly

This changes the implementation of RecentReposHelper to base it off a
single recently-used list, rather than one list per User/Org context.
I think this'll make it easier to add repos to the recently used-list
when spontaneously viewing repos without an explicit User/Org context,
and would make generating an overall list of most-recently viewed repos
easier if one was required.

The list of recently viewed repos help is now longer, at a maximum of 20
items, but only 5 'recently viewed' repos are displayed in each Org
context - the extra is to ensure that viewing 5 or more repos in one Org
context doesn't completely deplete the recent-repos in another.

to the actionbar shown in the early prototype by matt:

http://c.gr4m.com/16432p3Z1o1C1n3W1A32

The 'recent' repo labelling is broken by this, need to revisit that

title: Fix initiation/ensuring of user-login
message:
Fix initiation/ensuring of user-login

The problem with making sure the user is authenticated is that getting
them to sign in is a process that will block, so you can't reasonably
expect anything that occurs on the main thread to have a guaranteed
reference to authenticated GitHub credentials.

Fortunately, when people are doing network access it *has* to be on a
background thread. We can enforce that these background threads have
required the user to login, so at the point of executing the api
request, we will have credentials and can set them on the request.

Implementation-wise the important classes for this change are
AuthenticatedUserLoader & AuthenticatedUserTask, which enforce
that the user must be signed in before the rest of their background
threads run, LateAuthenticatedGitHubClient which only attempts to read
the GitHub credentials immediately before making it's API request
(which is implicitly on the background thread) and GitHubAccountScope,
a custom Guice scope used by the async loader/task classes to ensure
that the user is logged in and to make those GitHubAccount credentials
available for injection.

This commit also improves the background android-account sync in that
it now respects the account supplied to onPerformSync().

title: Remove Avatar sqlite storage as it's now on disk, post 3fb3081
message:
Remove Avatar sqlite storage as it's now on disk, post 3fb3081

The default implementation of lazy-drawables storage is to cache to the
filesystem, which I think is appropriate for avatar blobs, as they are
not going to have db queries constructed on them.

Because our avatar file store is in the app's 'cache' folder we also get
a couple of nice things for free: the folder will be automatically
cleared by the operating system if disk space is tight, which is better than
us swelling a database file which can't be easily shrunk by the OS. The
android platform also gives the user the option to clear an apps cache
on the 'manage app' page - the user can use this as a brute-force
method to refresh their avatars.

title: Fix #18 : avatars duplicated on initial load
message:
Fix #18 : avatars duplicated on initial load

This fix switches the implementation of AvatarHelper (which used the
'tag' field of the ImageView for tracking loaded updates) to use
https://github.com/rtyley/lazy-drawables (which uses a custom drawable
that updates itself to the same end).

some other small improvements:

* keys off gravatar id rather than the avatar_url supplied by the GitHub
api. This allows us to show avatars against commits, even though those
commits may have been made by people who aren't GitHub users, and allows
us to use the same pool of avatar images for both
* avatar images in the in-memory cache are pre-scaled to the right size
for the ImageView, which saves the android platform from having to do it
whenever the avatar is re-used - helps performance on scrolling thru big
lists
* uses streaming on download to avoid allocating a full byte array for
the compressed image data
* does a bit more work (decompressing image data) on the non-UI thread,
to avoid jerkiness

also closes #5

title: Add Android Beam for Issues
message:
Add Android Beam for Issues

The Beam API calls are wrapped in the 'Beam' class, so that the
classloaders of earlier devices don't throw exceptions.

To get Beam to work, you need to specify in your activity code that
you're going to broadcast a Beam message, and in your manifest that
your activity is interested in receiving particular Beam messages. We
filter here by specifying the "application/vnd.github.repo.issue+json"
mime type for messages.

The integration test exposed an interesting bug in robotium - if you
decide to skip the body of a test (eg because beam isn't available for
the device under test), the teardown method will hang on the robotium
method finishOpenedActivities() - it has a lethal little loop that
doesn't die:

https://github.com/jayway/robotium/blob/robotium-3.1/robotium-solo/src/main/java/com/jayway/android/robotium/solo/ActivityUtils.java#L120..L122


NFC & Beam documentation:
http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/nfc/nfc.html

title: Make sure proguard knows about the concise newArraylist() from Guava
message:
Make sure proguard knows about the concise newArraylist() from Guava

I wanted to use the concise no-generic-declaration newArraylist() method
from Guava in the integration tests, but because the Guava library is
used in the main app, and proguard didn't see the newArraylist() method
there, it stripped it out and the integration test failed with a
'unable to resolve static method' dalvik VM error.

Rather than futz about with a proguard rule, this commit just ensures
that the method is seen in the main app, so proguard doesn't strip it
out.

- and obviously, shouldn't use a 'real' user account.

title: Fix broken GitHubApiTest integration test
message:
Fix broken GitHubApiTest integration test

It's kinda interesting how the test was broken by this innocuous change:

https://github.com/github/android/commit/65348dd

The change is that the 'getRepositories()' method is no longer used in
the main app (replaced by 'getOrgRepositories()'), and so is stripped by
proguard, but it's still used in the integration test. With recent
changes to the android-maven-plugin, the contributing library is only
processed by proguard once, so the explicit usage in the integration
tests isn't enough to get the 'getRepositories()' method kept - an
explicit proguard rule has to be added.

title: Auto-update manifest version name & code using android-maven-plugin
message:
Auto-update manifest version name & code using android-maven-plugin

This change turns on manifest-update with the android-maven-plugin:

http://maven-android-plugin-m2site.googlecode.com/svn/manifest-update-mojo.html#manifest

The version name & code are auto-updated to reflect the pom version, which
as usual is incremented by the maven release process (has the nice
side-effect of git-tagging the code).

Note that the manifest files will be auto-formatted using JAXP transformer
defaults.


Also simplifying proguard config by using the android-maven-plugin
proguard goal (which is somewhat stricter- if you have a method that is
*only* used in your integration test project, you need to explicitely
specify keeping it in the proguard.cfg)

title: Ensure Java compiler targets Java 1.6 so ProGuard doesn't bork
message:
Ensure Java compiler targets Java 1.6 so ProGuard doesn't bork

If you're running on Java 7, the compiler defaults to 1.7 and ProGuard
doesn't support Java 7 class files (support's coming with proguard 4.7) -
you get an error like this;

[proguard] Reading library jar [/var/lib/jenkins/tools/Auto_Java_6/jre/lib/rt.jar]
 [proguard] java.io.IOException: Can't read [proguard.ClassPathEntry@16e14f9] (Can't process class [com/oracle/net/Sdp$1.class] (Unsupported version number [51.0] for class format))
 [proguard] 	at proguard.InputReader.readInput(InputReader.java:230)
 [proguard] 	at proguard.InputReader.readInput(InputReader.java:200)
 [proguard] 	at proguard.InputReader.readInput(InputReader.java:178)
 [proguard] 	at proguard.InputReader.execute(InputReader.java:100)
 [proguard] 	at proguard.ProGuard.readInput(ProGuard.java:195)
 [proguard] 	at proguard.ProGuard.execute(ProGuard.java:78)
 [proguard] 	at proguard.ProGuard.main(ProGuard.java:499)

compare the effect of changes.

objects from the egit-github library if we can get away with simple
strings.

title: Update to ActionBarSherlock 3.5.0
message:
Update to ActionBarSherlock 3.5.0

Sadly the bizarre compilation errors still occur when trying to make
GitHubAuthenticatorActivity indirectly extend FragmentActivity:

ERROR] /home/roberto/github/github-android-parent/github-android/src/main/java/com/github/mobile/android/authenticator/GitHubAuthenticatorActivity.java:[92,19] onCreateOptionsMenu(android.view.Menu) in com.github.mobile.android.authenticator.GitHubAuthenticatorActivity cannot override onCreateOptionsMenu(android.view.Menu) in android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity; overridden method is final
[ERROR] /home/roberto/github/github-android-parent/github-android/src/main/java/com/github/mobile/android/authenticator/GitHubAuthenticatorActivity.java:[99,19] onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem) in com.github.mobile.android.authenticator.GitHubAuthenticatorActivity cannot override onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem) in android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity; overridden method is final

...so GitHubAuthenticatorActivity still simply extends RoboAccountAuthenticatorActivity
rather than RoboAccountAuthenticatorFragmentActivity and can't show the
ActionBar. The compilation problem (which is incorrect so far as I can
tell, the overridden methods are *not* final) will hopefully go away with
ABS 4, as that version is slated to remove the custom, patched version
of the compatibility library.

title: Ensure orgs are loaded on resume to cope with the OAuth sign-in flow
message:
Ensure orgs are loaded on resume to cope with the OAuth sign-in flow

If you leave the app, and come back again, the Activity isn't re-created,
just resumed, and this can mean that it doesn't re-render to show the
signed-in details.

title: use insane roboguice version built against ABS
message:
use insane roboguice version built against ABS

Unfortunately the ABS version of the compat lib has some different
method signatures that mean you can't use a roboguice compiled against
the official compat lib - you just get MethodNotFoundErrors.

Once ABS 4.0 comes out (which will no longer incorperate patched
compat libs) we can get rid of this custom build.

title: This makes the app look so much better on ICS
message:
This makes the app look so much better on ICS

Given GitHub site colours and the early mobile-views I've seen, I think
it's ineveitable that we won't want to use the default 'dark' theme used by
Android and go for the light alternative both pre- and post- Honeycomb.

This little bit of config just ensures that we use the light *holo* theme
on ICS, switches on the actionbar, and just looks much better.

title: Fix dashboard display on ICS by moving uses-sdk to correct location
message:
Fix dashboard display on ICS by moving uses-sdk to correct location

The 'uses-sdk' element should be nested in the top-level 'manifest'
element, not in the 'application' element - where it is completely
ignored and leads to a very broken display in Ice Cream Sandwich- the
screen goes black with a one-quarter blank white rectangle.

http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/uses-sdk-element.html

title: Target Android 4.0
message:
Target Android 4.0

There are benefits to 'targetting' later versions - in fact, if you
show you're awere of them by targetting later versions, you get
automatic upgrades, e.g.:

http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/actionbar.html#Adding

Note that this is using artifacts coming from the
maven-android-sdk-deployer, so you'll need to run that before building.

title: Hardware acceleration ftw
message:
Hardware acceleration ftw

http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2011/03/android-30-hardware-acceleration.html

No reason not to have this switched on, unless you're doing something very
unusual.

title: do all the screen-sizes
message:
do all the screen-sizes

If you omit this you can get black borders around your content - this was
happening on my HTC sensation.

http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/supports-screens-element.html

title: Use patched version of RoboGuice which use current compat lib
message:
Use patched version of RoboGuice which use current compat lib

The currently released version of RoboGuice (2.0b2) depends on a version
of the Android compatibility library which is no longer easily available.
There's a bug open on RoboGuice to fix this:

http://code.google.com/p/roboguice/issues/detail?id=146

Normally you would use maven exclusions as a stop-gap measure for dealing
with this... but they're broken in the current release of the
android-maven-plugin:

https://github.com/jayway/maven-android-plugin/pull/76

title: Avoid transitive dep on android compatibility-v13
message:
Avoid transitive dep on android compatibility-v13

...it was breaking the build.

RoboGuice should be updated to remove the need for this conf soon enough:

https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/roboguice/jVri0A2U4TM

http://code.google.com/p/roboguice/issues/detail?id=146

title: Use currently available version (r4) of compatibility lib
message:
Use currently available version (r4) of compatibility lib

These are all installed by the maven-android-sdk-deployer from the android
sdk - r3 is no longer available.

http://developer.android.com/sdk/compatibility-library.html

title: Add depedendency on GitHub Java API.
message:
Add depedendency on GitHub Java API.

This required obfuscating the org.apache dependencies
so that they do not clash with the build in Android versions.

This required registering a custom log factory that forwards
the Android Log utility

title: Version .project and .classpath files.
message:
Version .project and .classpath files.

Checking these files in allows the projects to be imported
into Eclipse without any local configuration.

title: Remove duplicate groupId from child pom.xml file
message: Remove duplicate groupId from child pom.xml file

title: use com.github.mobile.android as we unambiguously own com.github.mobile ns
message:
use com.github.mobile.android as we unambiguously own com.github.mobile ns

The package id (which uniquely identifies the app on the Android Market) is
now com.github.mobile.android rather than com.github.android.app -
android.github.com is actually controlled by the AOSP.

The package id is specified in the AndroidManifest.xml, and actual Java
classes can be referred to relative to that package name, so it makes sense
to change the Java package names to match.

Also updated Maven POM's to use com.github.github as the group id - again,
because we we completely control that namespace
